title: Overtyping and Ctrl+X should delete selected text in the prompt
body: Right now if I select text that I've just typed and not executed, and press Ctrl+X, it acts like Ctrl-C and copies.  It really should remove the text...

comments.body: Yeah, almost everywhere else in Windows Ctrl+x is cut.
Perhaps the overall 'line editing' (ala the original readline interaction) should be followed; then my fingers don't have to figure out which command shell I'm in.
Yeah, although Ctrl+Backspace can delete word-at-a-time, it would be nice to del/backspace and wipe the full selection.
Along the same vein, with text selected pressing Delete or Backspace only deletes the last character of the selection and not the entire selection as expected.
That is, Ctrl+X should CUT, not COPY :-)
